question: Is the turkey organic?
answer: Yes, ma'am.

question: Well what does organic mean?
answer: It means there's no additives or preservatives and it's hormone free.

answer: I haven't heard about that. But I may not be informed enough to comment.

question: Well, you're not a doctor, so you shouldn't comment.

question: You are correct, I am not a doctor. You should come see me do stand-up tonight at the Comedy and Magic Club.
answer: I can't go through that again, man, that was painful.

question: That was five months ago. I've gotten a lot better.

question: I had a joke once about how you never see incredibly hot, blonde, homeless women. Because someone will always take care of that kind of woman. That woman could be the dumbest person on earth and she will survive in this world.
answer: Maybe something like... you can be hot and stupid and survive in the world. And you can be smart and ugly and survive in the world. The people who have trouble are the stupid, ugly people.

answer: Let me keep that one, because I thought of most of it.

question: I decided I like it here. Living with you guys keeps me grounded. I don't want to be the guy living in the house on the hill. Even though I could afford it. Hey, I saw that girl comic you like who lives upstairs. I invited her in. She's here.

question: You were right, she is pretty mousy and sexy. You gotta talk to her.

question: Nice to meet you. I think I gave you quarters once. Ira walks over to the kitchen area, takes out a paper cup. question: Well how long is he going to do?

question: Ah life. What does it mean? sometimes life makes perfect sense. And then you `come'.

question: I was thinking you need to tell someone about your situation... your condition.

question: Nah, I was going to watch four hockey games at once. I've never done that.
answer: okay, but I've got to run out and grab some cigarettes.

question: But you don't smoke.
answer: I never smoked in front of you because you were sick. But I do. Holy shit, holy shit. Where's the fucking airport around here? Ira tries to figure out how to work the navigation system in a panic. He can't make it work.

question: Where are you, where are you? You have to come back here. I need your help. I don't know how to do this. He walks back to where the kids are. They are watching tv. All around the room are family pictures. He is beginning to feel bad about what is happening.
answer: I think my mom and dad are getting a divorce. I don't want my parents to get divorced. All my friends' parents are divorced, and they're not happy.

question: Why would you say that?
answer: I heard my mom talking to her friend. I listened through the wall. She was looking for a lawyer. He cheated on her. What does cheating mean? That he's going to marry someone else? Why don't they just try harder?

question: Yeah, this is the Air China First Class Lounge. REVEAL that everyone else in the lounge is Chinese. What the fuck is going on? What the fuck is going on, Laura?
answer: I don't know what to say.

question: Tel- me the truth ! Just tell me the tri.t_h.;_
answer: I came here to tell you that I wanted you to move out when you came home. But I realized this was a mistake, so I didn't say it. Please don't hold that against me. We've worked everything out. Everything is fine.

question: You shouldn't joke about my disease. That was very serious. Very scary. Clarke punches him several times, but they are more like martial arts hits. What the hell is that? Ira arrives. George starts yelling at Ira. Don't jump in. Whatever you do, don't jump in. I don't want your help!
answer: Okay.

question: You said you were getting cigarettes then you ran to the airport to stop her. What kind of friend are you?
answer: I am a good friend because this entire situation is crazy. You are out of control.

question: I didn't deserve what you did to me. You betrayed me !
answer: When I got there, she was already kissing him. I never even had a chance to stop it. I didn't get to do anything!

question: Don't hit me! I've been sick! They don't know. The medicine is working now, but I'm still sick. Clarke punches George. What are you doing? I said to jump in!
answer: You told me not to jump in.

question: That's what "don't jump in" means. It means "jump in." Help me! Ira steps in. Clarke hits him hard, then kicks him. You're a terrible fighter.
answer: I know, that's why I became a comedian, because everyone used to beat me up! George runs at Clarke who cracks him in the head hard, sending him to the floor. Then Ira takes a run at him and Clarke kicks Ira in the face twice, with both feet. Laura runs into the middle of the scene.

question: Laura, tell him. Tell him you want to be with me now. Laura doesn't answer. Laura?
answer: Why did you have to come here and confuse me? Everything was fine before you came here. Now everything is all screwed up.

question: Laura, what's it going to be? Are you going with him, or are you going with me? Laura looks at Clarke.
answer: With him.

question: Don't do this.
answer: You fucked up my life. And now I fucked up yours. But just a little. Probably just for a day. She walks back into the house.

question: Hit the road before I put you through another round.
answer: You cheated on her too!

question: Yeah, but we're married. We're going to work through this shit. You should have waited until you were married to cheat. It buys you another chance. Clarke punches George. Ira is on the ground. He doesn't get up.
answer: She told me I was the love of her life. And she loves me more than she loves you!

question: When she said that, did she think you were dying?
answer: Yeah!

question: Too bad you had to 'Live and find out it wasn't true. Leave my fucking family alone! Clarke punches him. George gets a punch in but it doesn't hurt Clarke. Clarke punches him again. I can do this all night.
answer: Stop Ira, you're hitting me too. Mable and Ingrid appear outside.

question: That was meaner than him punching you. That is a demented motherfucker. George punches Ira in the face. Ira fires back two punches at George's face and he stumbles back.
answer: None of you fuckers can hurt me. George pauses, then leaps onto Ira and they roll on the ground for a moment. Ira makes his-way free and gets up.

question: Get the hell off of me you psycho.
answer: Drive me home.

question: No.
answer: How are you gonna get home then?

question: Fine. You are the most self involved person I have ever met.
answer: Oh yeah?

question: No matter what the situation, no matter how many laughs or how many women you get you will never be happy. You're always going to be miserable. You are a bottomless pit. A bottomless wound.
answer: What about you? You are just a lackey. Who are you to judge me? You tried to screw me over, after all I. have done for you.

question: I am not responsible for you. You wanted me to sit back and destroy this woman's life? Help you cheat on her? You put me in a terrible position. I don't give a fuck, go fuck yourself.
answer: Lacky.

question: You made me the tacky? I'm not a lacky, it's a job.
answer: It's not a job, you're a tacky. You're not even that fucking funny. This gets Ira very mad.

question: Who cares? If being funny means being like you, I rather be a little less funny.
answer: Mission accomplished.

question: You're the only person I know who learned nothing from a near-death experience! You actually went backwards. All it did was it brought out what a prick you are, brought everything bad to the surface. I liked you better when I was sure you were gonna die.
answer: I'm not going anywhere!

question: Everything is about you. You don't even know where I live. You've never asked me one question about my life. How much can one person talk about himself ? You never ask me shit about anything!
answer: Who are you to fucking judge anyone? You're not my friend, you just want my money. You just want to get your foot in the door.

question: Fuck your money. Fuck you. This has all been a huge mistake.
answer: Wake me when we get home. George climbs in the back seat and tries to go to bed.

question: okay, I'm getting out. You have to drive yourself home. I'm getting out here.
answer: Why didn't you drive me to my house?

question: Because then I'd still have your car.
answer: You'll drop it off later.

question: There is no later! I'm not going to ever talk to you again. So I don't want your car.
answer: So that's how it's going to be.
